page.title: 18 Port Meadow Oxford
page.content: Port Meadow is a low lying common land,down one side runs the River Thames.In winter the river floods and if it freezes people go skating on the ice .In the spring the flood water helps a lush crop of grass which the horses,cows and geese feed upon. Sheep are not allowed to feed on the meadow because they cut the grass too short so the cows can't get at it.Once a year the sheriff has a roundÂ£up of all the livestock on the meadow and if some are not claimed he sells them.The few geese that are kept there are very fierce;Wild Brent geese mix with Greylags and White Fronted tame ones. Port Meadow has been a place of scientific interest since 1952.Apart from the livestock,there is an abundance of wildlife: herons, waterÂ£rats, foxes, Shelducks, Garganies and Firecrests.
